Oldest engineering discipline (after Military).

slides.title: Structural Engineering
slides.content:
# Standing Up ğŸ¢

Ensuring buildings don't fall down.
- **Dead Load**: Weight of the building itself.
- **Live Load**: Weight of people/furniture.
- **Environmental Load**: Wind/Snow/Earthquake.

slides.title: Geotechnical Engineering
slides.content:
# Soil & Rock ğŸª¨

Building on the ground.
- Everything sits on soil.
- **Foundation**: Spreading load to prevent sinking.
- **Soil Mechanics**: Testing dirt strength.

slides.content:
# Moving People ğŸ›£ï¸

- **Highway Design**: Curves, banking, traffic flow.
- **Traffic Engineering**: Timing lights to reduce jams.
- **Railways & Airports**.

slides.title: Bridge Design
slides.content:
# Crossing Gaps ğŸŒ‰

- **Beam Bridge**: Simple plank.
- **Arch Bridge**: Uses compression (Stone/Roman).
- **Suspension Bridge**: Cables (Golden Gate).
- **Cable-Stayed**: Cables directly from tower.

slides.title: Materials: Concrete
slides.content:
# Liquid Stone ğŸ§±

Cement + Sand + Gravel + Water.
- **Hydration**: Chemical reaction that hardens it (It generates heat!).
- Great in Compression (Squeezing).
- Weak in Tension (Pulling).

slides.title: Reinforced Concrete
slides.content:
# Steel + Stone ğŸ¤

Concrete loves Compression. Steel loves Tension.
- Adding steel bars (Rebar) inside concrete makes it strong everywhere.
- Used in almost all modern construction.
